text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide hl7.fhir.uv.phenomics-exchange

PhenomicsExchange

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/phenomics-exchange/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.uv.phenomics-exchange

FHIR implementation guide for the Global Alliance for Genomics and Health Phenopacket standard.

name: PhenomicsExchange
title: Phenomics Exchange for Research and Diagnostics
description: FHIR implementation guide for the Global Alliance for Genomics and Health Phenopacket standard.

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology

resource.name: A VALID karyotypic sex Observation instance.
resource.description: A VALID karyotypic sex Observation instance.

resource.name: A valid phenotypic abnormality Observation example.
resource.description: A valid phenotypic abnormality Observation example.

resource.name: ACMG Pathogenicity Classification
resource.description: One of the five ACMG pathogenicity categories, default is UNCERTAIN_SIGNIFICANCE.

resource.name: ACMG Pathogenicity Classification Value Set
resource.description: Describes the ACMG five-tier pathogenicity classification system (Richards et al., 2015, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4544753/).

resource.name: Additional Variant Identifier
resource.description: Used to  list of unique identifiers where available. If this is a dbSNP variant, component[dbSNP-id] should be used instead.

resource.name: amyotrophy
resource.description: Skeletal muscle atrophy (HP:0003202)

resource.name: An INVALID karyotypic sex Observation instance.
resource.description: An INVALID karyotypic sex Observation instance.

resource.name: An INVALID phenotypic abnormality Observation example.
resource.description: An INVALID phenotypic abnormality Observation example.

resource.name: arachnodactyly
resource.description: PhenotypicFeature Example for arachnodactyly

resource.name: Biosample
resource.description: A unit of biological material from which the substrate molecules (e.g. genomic DNA, RNA, proteins) for molecular analyses (e.g. sequencing, array hybridisation, mass-spectrometry) are extracted.

resource.name: bladderCarcinoma
resource.description: Biosample Example for bladder carcinoma

resource.name: Categories
resource.description: Various categories or tags

resource.name: Categories
resource.description: Various categories or tags

resource.name: CHF-stageIII
resource.description: Congestive heart failure, New York Heart Association stage III

resource.name: CHF-with-severity
resource.description: PhenotypicFeature Example for severe Low-output congestive heart failure

resource.name: Codeable temporal element extension
resource.description:
An extension to represent the value of a quantitative temporal element in the form of a concept.

The extension is intentionally generic in nature. The meaning of the temporal concept is taken from
the context it is used in, and the concepts used in the value should conceptually make sense in that context.
This extension should be used on the most specific element possible so that the coded value can be interpreted
withing that element.

For example, it can be used on Observation.effective.valuePeriod.start have a coded start value.

resource.name: Coded Onset
resource.description: The onset of a disease using an ontology class.

resource.name: Diagnostic Marker
resource.description: Clinically relevant biomarkers. Most of the assays such as immunohistochemistry (IHC) are covered by the NCIT under the sub-hierarchy NCIT:C36292 (Laboratory Test Result), e.g. NCIT:C68748 (HER2/Neu Positive), NCIT:C131711 (Human Papillomavirus-18 Positive).

resource.name: Diagnostic Marker
resource.description: Codes to indicate clinically relevant bio markers.

resource.name: Disease profile
resource.description: This profile stipulates that a FHIR Condition must have a codeable concept that represents the disease. The concepts can be taken from various ontologies, but for rare-disease concepts, we recommend MONDO.

resource.name: example-patient
resource.description: Example of Patient

resource.name: excluded-disease
resource.description: Phenopacket Example for an excluded disease

resource.name: fiberSizeVariability
resource.description: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter (HP:0003557)

resource.name: Filter Status
resource.description: Filter status: PASS if this position has passed all filters.

resource.name: GENO Ontology Allelic State Value Set
resource.description: Descendent terms of GENO_0000875

resource.name: globalDevelopmentalDelay
resource.description: Global developmental delay (HP:0001263)

resource.name: Histological Diagnosis
resource.description: This is the pathologist’s diagnosis and may often represent a refinement of the clinical diagnosis (which could be reported in the Phenopacket that contains this Biosample). Normal samples would be tagged with the term “NCIT:C38757”, “Negative Finding”.

resource.name: HistologicalDiagnosis
resource.description: Histological diagnosis codes from NCIT.

resource.name: Hpo Severity Value Set
resource.description: The HPO codes for phenotypic feature severity

resource.name: HTS Format
resource.description: An enumeration used to represent different high-throughput sequencing file formats.

resource.name: hypotonia
resource.description: Hypotonia (HP:0001252)

resource.name: Individual
resource.description: The subject of the Phenopacket is represented by an Individual element. This element intends to represent an individual human or other organism.

resource.name: intellectualDisabilityDisease
resource.description: Intellectual disability (disease)

resource.name: Interpretation Status
resource.description: Describes the conclusion made about the genomic interpretation.

resource.name: Interpretation Status Value Set
resource.description: Describes the conclusion made about the genomic interpretation.

resource.name: Karyotypic Sex
resource.description: Karyotypic sex of an individual (also known as chromosomal sex).

resource.name: Karyotypic sex code system
resource.description: karyotypic sex of an individual (also known as chromosomal sex)

resource.name: Karyotypic sex value set
resource.description: The karyotypic (chromosomal) sex of an individual

resource.name: longPhiltrum
resource.description: Long philtrum (HP:0000343)

resource.name: losartan
resource.description: Treatment Example (Losartan))

resource.name: lowSetEars
resource.description: Low-set ears (HP:0000369)

resource.name: lvdysfunction-excluded
resource.description: PhenotypicFeature Example for exclusion of LV dysfunction

resource.name: Material Sample
resource.description: Type of sample (diseases, control, etc.)

resource.name: Measurement
resource.description: This profile defines the GA4GH Measurement element in terms of the FHIR Observation

resource.name: Measurement (Biosample)
resource.description: Term representing a measurement made on a Biosample

resource.name: microphthalmia
resource.description: Long philtrum (HP:0000568)

resource.name: Molecule Context
resource.description: The molecular context of the vrs variation.

resource.name: Molecule Context Value Set
resource.description: Describes The molecular context of the variant. Default is unspecified_molecule_context.

resource.name: muscleBiopsy
resource.description: Biosample Example -- muscle biopsy

resource.name: muscleWeakness
resource.description: Muscle weakness (HP:0001324)

resource.name: MVP-with-onset
resource.description: PhenotypicFeature Example for mitral value prolapse with onset

resource.name: Observation categories
resource.description: ValueSet description here

resource.name: Observation Codes for status of a PhenotypicFeature
resource.description: The LOINC codes for present if a feature is observed and absent if a feature was excluded.

resource.name: Onset
resource.description: Describes the age at which a phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed.

resource.name: Onset ValueSet
resource.description: Set of HPO codes that denote the onset of a disease or phenotypic feature. The codes are descendants of Onset (HP:0003674) or from SNOMED_CT (282032007).

resource.name: Pathological TNM Finding
resource.description: Pathological TNM findings, if applicable. Corresponds to pathological_tnm_finding (GA4GH)

resource.name: Pathological Tumor Stage
resource.description: This element can be used if the phenopacket describes cancer. Tumor staging describes the extent of growth of cancer, including the tumor and, if applicable, affected lymph nodes and distant metastases. This element should not be confused with clinical stage.

resource.name: PeterGeneticist
resource.description: Extended example: example practitioner

resource.name: Phenopacket (static snapshot of clinical findings to support differential diagnosis of a child with developmental delay).
resource.description: Example use case for a child with undiagnosed developmental delay

resource.name: phenopacket Patient Example01
resource.description: This is an example of a patient resource to be used in the assocaited patient examples. It is not representative of phenopackets patient's data representation

resource.name: phenopacket Practitioner Example01
resource.description:
This is an incomplete example that used as 
               a placeholder for a curated Practitioner example

resource.name: Phenopacket profile
resource.description: This is the main element that represents the Phenopacket in FHIR.

resource.name: phenopacket Specimen Example01
resource.description:
This is an incomplete example that used as
               a placeholder for a curated specimen example

resource.name: Phenopackets Genomic Interpretation
resource.description:
A profile of Genomics Reporting Genomics Report profile that represents relevant 
              phenopackets building blocks.

resource.name: Phenopackets Genomic Interpretation Example-1
resource.description:
This is an example of phenopackets-variant which is a phenopackets profile of
              the genomics reporting Genomics Report profile.
              It represents phenopackets GenomicInterpretation building block, i.e., the
              interpretation for an individual variant or gene.

resource.name: Phenopackets Genomic Interpretation Example-2
resource.description:
This is an example of phenopackets-variant which is a phenopackets profile of
              the genomics reporting Genomics Report profile.
              It represents phenopackets GenomicInterpretation building block, i.e., the
              interpretation for an individual variant or gene.

resource.name: Phenopackets Variant
resource.description: A profile of Genomics Reporting Variant profile that represents relevant phenopackets building blocks.

resource.name: Phenopackets Variant Example-1
resource.description:
This is an example of phenopackets-genomic-interpretation
              which is a phenopackets profile of the genomics reporting Variant profile.
              It represents phenopackets GeneDescriptor, VariationDescriptor, VcfRecord,
              and VariantInterpretation building blocks.

resource.name: PhenopacketsBundleExample01
resource.description: Example Phenopacket Bundle instance

resource.name: Phenotypic abnormality ValueSet
resource.description: ValueSet description here

resource.name: Phenotypic component ValueSet
resource.description: ValueSet description here

resource.name: Phenotypic Feature
resource.description: This is an Observation profile to represent a phenotypic feature (a phenotype) of a patient. It is inspired by and aligned with the [GA4GH PhenotypicFeature entity](https://phenopacket-schema.readthedocs.io/en/latest/phenotype.html).

resource.name: Phenotypic Feature (Biosample)
resource.description: Term representing phenotypic features of a Biosample

resource.name: Phenotypic modifier ValueSet
resource.description: Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) Clinical Modifier terms

resource.name: Phred Quality Score
resource.description: Used to include Phred-scaled quality score for the assertion made in ALT.

resource.name: Polydactyly-with-modifier
resource.description: Bilateral postaxial Polydactyly, example to demonstrate use of Clinical Modifier

resource.name: Proband1
resource.description: Example child with developmental delay

resource.name: reducedVisualAcuity
resource.description: Reduced visual acuity (HP:0007663)

resource.name: Related Concept ID
resource.description: Used to provide identifiers to alternative resources representing related, but not equivalent concepts, for example gene ortholog ids

resource.name: retinalDetachment
resource.description: Retinal detachment (HP:0000541)

resource.name: Section Type
resource.description: Section Type

resource.name: Sequence Ontology Structural Variant Value Set
resource.description: Descendent terms of SO:0001537.

resource.name: service-request-supporting-info
resource.description: Search ServiceRequest by supporting resource parameters

resource.name: Taxonomy
resource.description: Corresponds to taxonomy (GA4GH). For resources where there may be more than one organism being studied it is advisable to indicate the taxonomic identifier of that organism, to its most specific level.

resource.name: Taxonomy
resource.description: Taxonomic identifiers of an organism.

resource.name: tga
resource.description: Transposition of the great arteries (HP:0001669)

resource.name: Therapeutic Actionability
resource.description: one of the five ACMG pathogenicity categories, or NOT_PROVIDED. The default is NOT_PROVIDED.

resource.name: Therapeutic Actionability Value Set
resource.description: Describes the therapeutic actionability of the variant.

resource.name: This is an example of a composition resource that represents some of the Phenopackets data elements
resource.description: Example Phenopacket Composition instance

resource.name: thrombocytopenia
resource.description: Measurement Example for thrombocytopenia

resource.name: Treatment
resource.description: This profile defines the GA4GH Treatment element in terms of the FHIR MedicationAdministration

resource.name: Tumor Grade
resource.description: List of terms representing the tumor grade.

resource.name: Tumor Grade
resource.description: Codes to indicate the grade of a tumor.

resource.name: Tumor Progression
resource.description: This field can be used to indicate if a specimen is from the primary tumor, a metastasis or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen should have a specific meaning that is application specific.

resource.name: Tumor Progression
resource.description: Codes to indicate if a specimen is from the primary tumor, a metastasis or a recurrence.

resource.name: Tumor Stage
resource.description: Codes to represent the stage of a tumor.

resource.name: VCF Info
resource.description: Additional information: Semicolon-separated series of additional information fields from VCF info field.

resource.name: vitreoretinochoroidopathy
resource.description: Phenopacket Example for autosomal dominant vitreoretinochoroidopathy
